channel.title: Comments on: Getting Started with Angular 2.0
channel.description: Knowing is different & Doing is different

item.title: By: you
item.dc:creator: you
item.content:encoded:
this shit is insane man ! insane
la chalitaaaaaaa

@Injectable()
export class AutocompleteService {

private autocompleteObserver: any;
public autocomplete: any;

constructor(…) {
this.autocompleteObserver = null;

this.autocomplete = Observable.create(observer => {
this.autocompleteObserver = observer;
});
}

item.title: By: Mack
item.dc:creator: Mack
item.description: first problem with this tutorial is after git clone the directory structure looks nothing like what is shown here. 2nd problem maybe related to the first is the install of gulp doesn't work either. That's all the time I'm gonna waste on this. Not sure why you created this tutorial as it only serves as a time waster. Either get it right or don't post it. Sheesh.
item.content:encoded:
first problem with this tutorial is after git clone the directory structure looks nothing like what is shown here. 2nd problem maybe related to the first is the install of gulp doesn’t work either.
That’s all the time I’m gonna waste on this.
Not sure why you created this tutorial as it only serves as a time waster.
Either get it right or don’t post it. Sheesh.

item.title: By: razorree
item.dc:creator: razorree
item.description: a big mess..... AngularJS2 mixed with JS (JS on a server side ??? )... where is the backend ? how to use AngularJS2 with a backend stuff (like Java) ?
item.content:encoded: a big mess….. AngularJS2 mixed with JS (JS on a server side ??? )… where is the backend ? how to use AngularJS2 with a backend stuff (like Java) ?

item.title: By: bradykelly
item.dc:creator: bradykelly
item.description: Your directory structure cloned by Git looks nothing like your diagram, and, more importantly, it contains no gulpfile.
item.content:encoded: Your directory structure cloned by Git looks nothing like your diagram, and, more importantly, it contains no gulpfile.

item.title: By: Code Self Study
item.dc:creator: Code Self Study
item.description:
I think that these commands are the same on Windows, Linux, and Mac. The difference is in Python versions.
Python 3: python -m http.server
Python 2: python -m SimpleHTTPServer
item.content:encoded:
I think that these commands are the same on Windows, Linux, and Mac. The difference is in Python versions.

Python 3:
python -m http.server

Python 2:
python -m SimpleHTTPServer

item.title: By: Andrei
item.dc:creator: Andrei
item.description: Gulp fails - error in plugin run-sequence

item.title: By: Rachit Bhasin
item.dc:creator: Rachit Bhasin
item.description: I'm getting error 'cannot find module "gulp-traceur" ' when I run the gulp command. So I ran 'npm install --save gulp-traceur'. Now i'm getting 'cannot find module "gulp-sourcemaps" '. Is there something that I'm missing? Or i'll have to install each module one at a time.
item.content:encoded: I’m getting error ‘cannot find module “gulp-traceur” ‘ when I run the gulp command. So I ran ‘npm install –save gulp-traceur’. Now i’m getting ‘cannot find module “gulp-sourcemaps” ‘. Is there something that I’m missing? Or i’ll have to install each module one at a time.

item.title: By: Ramachandran
item.dc:creator: Ramachandran
item.description: on top of that how come there is NO MATERIAL AVAILABLE ON THE SYSTEM UNDEFINED ERROR issue that comes up? There is no information in the net and it is strange most of them who actually try this code get this error but the poeple who write this article dont get this error? I tried 3 different variations of the same code but it just does not work in any browser at all. What we need is an answer for the RefernceError: System is not defined - how to take care of that
item.content:encoded: on top of that how come there is NO MATERIAL AVAILABLE ON THE SYSTEM UNDEFINED ERROR issue that comes up? There is no information in the net and it is strange most of them who actually try this code get this error but the poeple who write this article dont get this error? I tried 3 different variations of the same code but it just does not work in any browser at all. What we need is an answer for the RefernceError: System is not defined – how to take care of that

item.title: By: Ramachandran
item.dc:creator: Ramachandran
item.description: There is something wrong really however i do it i keep getting the system error.. i even went and downloaded es6-shim,js and put it in the folder still get the same error
item.content:encoded: There is something wrong really however i do it i keep getting the system error.. i even went and downloaded es6-shim,js and put it in the folder still get the same error

item.title: By: Jadoti
item.dc:creator: Jadoti
item.description: I did a fresh pull of the quickstart repository, and when I run gulp it fails on the whole rebuilding of angular2 and such.. It's throwing errors out of angular2.map and es5build.map... Repulled the repo to make sure it wasn't anything I did and sure enough it's the same error... Has something changed since you wrote this article?
item.content:encoded: I did a fresh pull of the quickstart repository, and when I run gulp it fails on the whole rebuilding of angular2 and such.. It’s throwing errors out of angular2.map and es5build.map… Repulled the repo to make sure it wasn’t anything I did and sure enough it’s the same error… Has something changed since you wrote this article?

item.title: By: Stevo
item.dc:creator: Stevo
item.description: Does not work in Safari 8. Javascript console says "SyntaxError: Cannot use initialiser syntax in a strict mode enumeration." in es6-shim.js line 4941
item.content:encoded: Does not work in Safari 8. Javascript console says “SyntaxError: Cannot use initialiser syntax in a strict mode enumeration.” in es6-shim.js line 4941

item.title: By: Nicky Lenaers
item.dc:creator: Nicky Lenaers
item.description: Great article really! I think it's a lot clearer than the 5min tutorial on the angular website. What I'm not getting: what is the purpose of runtime assertion? And what is actually happening behind the scenes at runtime? How does it perform compared to static loading? I would really like to know! Thanks man!
item.content:encoded: Great article really! I think it’s a lot clearer than the 5min tutorial on the angular website. What I’m not getting: what is the purpose of runtime assertion? And what is actually happening behind the scenes at runtime? How does it perform compared to static loading? I would really like to know! Thanks man!
